puzzles.title: Grace Hopper
puzzles.riddle:
Her work allowed the creation of Cobol. What is the message this program generates?

IDENTIFICATION DIVISION.
PROGRAM-ID. VARS.
DATA DIVISION.
WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
01 a PIC X(4) VALUE 'ask'.
01 b PIC X(12) VALUE 'forgiveness'.
01 c PIC X(7) VALUE 'easier'.
01 d PIC X(3) VALUE 'it'.
01 e PIC X(3) VALUE 'is'.
01 f PIC X(4) VALUE 'get'.
01 h PIC X(3) VALUE 'to'.
01 i PIC X(10) VALUE 'permission'.
01 g PIC X(5) VALUE 'than'.

PROCEDURE DIVISION.
DISPLAY "{"d e c h a b g d e h f i "}"
STOP RUN.
puzzles.answer: {it is easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission}

puzzles.title: Labyrinths
puzzles.riddle:
Locate the town/city these labyrinths are located:
Pumpkin
Pineapple
Sod
Mirror
Glass
Corn
Lavender

The answer is the names of towns/cities (without state) listed alphabetically
puzzles.answer: dixon kansas city mears minneapolis newport sterling wahiawa

puzzles.title: Selma

story.imageCaption: Police break up voting rights march in Selma

puzzles.riddle:
Hidden in these picture is a quote from Martin Luther King, Jr.

Amelia Boynton
Federal Marshal
Montgomery
Police beatings

Can you find and put the pieces together?
puzzles.answer: The end we seek is a society at peace with itself, a society that can live with its conscience. And that will be a day not of the white man, not of the black man. That will be the day of man as man.

puzzles.title: John Jay - YESCA code
puzzles.riddle: Find the papers archive of America's 1st Chief Justice. The library maintains an online exhibition.  Find cypher code page  (Diplomacy section, YESCA code).  Decode this message: 34 23 17 12: 26 23' 15 7 4 2 21. 16  27

puzzles.title: Pauline Cushman
puzzles.riddle: She became a spy by toasting who?

puzzles.title: Women's Suffrage
puzzles.riddle: Trivia: List alphabetically the 8 states that rejected the 19th amendment?
puzzles.answer: Alabama Delaware Georgia Louisiana Maryland Mississippi South Carolina Virginia

puzzles.title: Slave, Freed, Slave, Spy
puzzles.riddle:
Mary Richards Bowser: A freed woman, she took the role of working as a slave for Jefferson Davis in the Confederate White House. She used an SBOX cipher with Elizabeth Van Lew. Decipher

61 55 42 62 13 43 63 54
36 63 54 11 61 14 61 43 36 63 54
